intro: Genistella lasiantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved broom. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is known for its leguminous properties. Its leaves are typically narrow and pinnate, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Genistella lasiantha is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
